alert.note: Alert for Lee; Monroe; Pontotoc (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 2:49PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pontotoc, southern Lee and northwestern Monroe Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 249 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Trace State Park, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tupelo, Pontotoc, Verona, Trace State Park, Tombigbee State Park, Shannon, Plantersville, Troy, Furrs, Nettleton, Sherman, Nixon, Skyline, Endville, Belden, Palmetto, Bissell, Chesterville, Flowerdale and Rough Edge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
